Four points are coplanar if and only if the volume of the parallelepiped determined by them is 0.  The volume of the parallelepiped determined by $\mathbf{a},$ $\mathbf{b},$ and $\mathbf{c}$ is given by
\[|\mathbf{a} \cdot (\mathbf{b} \times \mathbf{c})|.\]Let $\mathbf{a} = \begin{pmatrix} a \\ 1 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix},$ $\mathbf{b} = \begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ b \\ 1 \end{pmatrix},$ and $\mathbf{c} = \begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ 1 \\ c \end{pmatrix}.$  Then
\begin{align*}
\mathbf{b} \times \mathbf{c} &= \begin{pmatrix} b - 1 \\ 1 - c \\ 1 - b \end{pmatrix}, \\
\mathbf{a} \cdot (\mathbf{b} \times \mathbf{c}) &= a(b - 1) + (1 - c) + (1 - b) \\
&= ab - a - c + 2 - b.
\end{align*}Hence,
\[ab - a - c + 2 - b = 0.\]Then $ab - a - b + 1 = c - 1,$ so
\[\frac{1}{1 - c} = \frac{1}{(a - 1)(b - 1)}.\]Similarly,
\begin{align*}
\frac{1}{1 - a} &= \frac{1}{(b - 1)(c - 1)}, \\
\frac{1}{1 - b} &= \frac{1}{(a - 1)(c - 1)}.
\end{align*}Adding these equations, we get
\[\frac{1}{1 - a} + \frac{1}{1 - b} + \frac{1}{1 - c} = \boxed{0}.\]
